sen.j: 高田 新家（たかた の にいのみ、大宝 (日本)3年（703年）7月23日?）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: TAKATA no Niinomi (year of birth and death unknown) is a historical figure who lived in Asuka period.
sen.cmt: 生没年に関しては、「飛鳥時代の人物」との表記や「事績」における年号の記載などから、生存していた時期はある程度限定できると判断し「生没年不詳」としました
sen.e: TAKATA no Niinomi (year of birth unknown - September 12, 703?) is a historical figure who lived during Japan's Asuka period.
sen.cmt: 没年は推測されているので新暦で記載し、原文通り「？」をつけました。
sen.e: TAKATA no Niinomi (year of birth unknown - September 12, 703?) is a historical figure who lived during Japan's Asuka period.

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いでの読みは「たかたのにひのみ」。
sen.e: His name is read as "TAKATA no Nihinomi" in old Japanese syllabary characters.
His name is pronounced "TAKATA no Nihinomi" in the old Japanese kana syllabary.
sen.cmt: 他ファイルのネイティブチェックを参考に修正しました。
sen.e: His name is pronounced "TAKATA no Nihinomi" in the old Japanese kana syllabary.

sen.j: 姓（カバネ）は首。
sen.e: His Kabane (hereditary title) is Obito.
His Kabane (hereditary title) is Obito.
His Kabane (hereditary title) is Obito.

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱のとき、東に向かう大海人皇子（天武天皇）を伊勢国の鈴鹿郡で出迎えた。
sen.e: In Jinshin War of 672, in Suzuka County, Ise Province, he greeted Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) who was heading west.
In Jinshin War of 672, in Suzuka County, Ise Province, he greeted Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) who was heading east.
In Jinshin War of 672, in Suzuka County, Ise Province, he greeted Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) who was heading east.

sen.j: 685年に天武天皇のため信濃国に行宮を作った。
sen.e: In 685, he built Angu (temporary palace) for Emperor Tenmu in Shinano Province.
In 685, he built Angu (temporary palace) for Emperor Tenmu in Shinano Province.
In 685, he built Angu (temporary palace) for Emperor Tenmu in Shinano Province.

sen.j: 贈従五位上。
sen.e: He was awarded Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).
He was awarded Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).
He was awarded Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).

sen.j: 壬申の乱の勃発時、高田新家は美濃国の主稲であった。
sen.e: When Jinshin War broke out, TAKATA no Niinomi was Syuto in Mino Province.
sen.cmt: 主稲→定訳不明：Syutoとしました
sen.e: When Jinshin War broke out, TAKATA no Niinomi was Syuto in Mino Province.
When Jinshin War broke out, TAKATA no Niinomi was Syuto in Mino Province.

sen.j: 兵をあげた大海人皇子はまず美濃国で兵を集めさせ、自らは24日に大和国の吉野宮を発って東に向かった。
sen.e: Prince Oama who rose up in arms ordered to gather the soldiers in Mino Province and he left Yoshino no Miya in Yamato province to move east on 24th.
Prince Oama who rose up in arms ordered to gather the soldiers in Mino Province and he left Yoshino no Miya in Yamato province to move east on 24th.
Prince Oama who rose up in arms ordered to gather the soldiers in Mino Province and he left Yoshino no Miya in Yamato province to move east on 24th.

sen.j: 25日に伊勢の鈴鹿郡で国司守の三宅石床、介の三輪子首、湯沐令の田中足麻呂、高田新家の出迎えを受けた。
sen.e: On 25th, he was greeted by Kokushi (provincial officer), MIYAKE no Iwatoko and Suke (assistant governor), MIWA no Kobito and Yunonagashi (manager of imperial territories), TANAKA no Tarimaro and TAKATA no Niinomi.
sen.cmt: 介→定訳不明：assistant governorとしました湯沐令→定訳不明：manager of imperial territoriesとしました
sen.e: On 25th, in Suzuka County, Ise Province, he was greeted by Ise no Kami (Governor of Ise) MIYAKE no Iwatoko, Suke (assistant governor) MIWA no Kobito, and Yunonagashi (manager of imperial territories) TANAKA no Tarimaro and TAKATA no Niinomi.
sen.cmt: 守と介は国司の等級なので国司は訳出せず、それぞれ訳語を修正しました。
sen.e: On 25th, in Suzuka County, Ise Province, he was greeted by Ise no Kami (Governor of Ise) MIYAKE no Iwatoko, Suke (assistant governor) MIWA no Kobito, and Yunonagashi (manager of imperial territories) TANAKA no Tarimaro and TAKATA no Niinomi.

sen.j: 高田新家は皇子に従って美濃国に行った。
sen.e: TAKATA no Niinomi accompanied Prince Oama to Mino Province.
TAKATA no Niinomi accompanied Prince Oama to Mino Province.
TAKATA no Niinomi accompanied Prince Oama to Mino Province.

sen.j: 乱の後、高田新家が功により40戸の封戸を与えられたことが、後述の704年の首名の記事から知られる。
sen.e: The article in 704 of Mui no Obitona, as mentioned later, says that TAKATA no Niinomi was given 40 fuko (a vassal household alotted to courtier, shrines and temples) for his achievement after the war.
sen.cmt: 無位首名→定訳不明：Mui no Obitona 位階のない「首名」という名の子かと推測しましたが判断できず読み方を見つけられませんでした
sen.e: The article in 704 of Mui no Obitona, as mentioned later, says that TAKATA no Niinomi was given 40 fuko (a vassal household alotted to courtier, shrines and temples) for his achievement after the war.

The article in 704 of Mui no Obitona, as mentioned later, says that TAKATA no Niinomi was given 40 fuko (a vassal household alotted to courtier, shrines and temples) for his achievement after the war.

sen.j: 天武天皇14年（685年）10月10日、高田新家は、軽部足瀬、荒田尾麻呂とともに、信濃国で行宮を作った。
sen.e: In October 10, 685, TAKATA no Niinomi built Angu (temporary palace) with KARUBE no Tarise and ARATAO no Maro in Shinano Province.
sen.cmt: 軽部足瀬→定訳不明：KARUBE no Tarise 該当する読み方を見つけられませんでした荒田尾麻呂→定訳不明：ARATAO no Maro 荒田尾赤麻呂のことかもしれませんが該当する読み方を見つけられませんでした
sen.e: In November 14, 685, TAKATA no Niinomi built Angu (temporary palace) with KARUBE no Tarise and ARATAO no Maro in Shinano Province.
In November 14, 685, TAKATA no Niinomi built Angu (temporary palace) with KARUBE no Tarise and ARATAO no Maro in Shinano Province.

sen.j: しかしその行宮が使われることはなかった。
sen.e: However, the Angu was never used.
However, the Angu was never used.
However, the Angu was never used.

sen.j: 大宝 (日本)3年（703年）7月23日に正六位上高田首新家は、壬申の年の功によって従五位上を贈られた。
sen.e: In July 23, 703 TAKATA no Obito Niinomi, Shorokuinojo (Senior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade) was awarded Jugoiinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).

In September 12, 703, TAKATA no Obito Niinomi, Shorokuinojo (Senior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade) was awarded Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) for his contributions made in the year of Jinshin (Mizunoe-Saru, one of the Oriental Zodiac).
sen.cmt: 新暦に変換しました。「壬申の年の功によって」の訳を追加しました。
sen.e: In September 12, 703, TAKATA no Obito Niinomi, Shorokuinojo (Senior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade) was awarded Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) for his contributions made in the year of Jinshin (Mizunoe-Saru, one of the Oriental Zodiac).

sen.j: この日かそれより前の近い時期に死んだと思われる。
sen.e: It is said that he died on this day or in the near term before the day.
It is assumed that he died on this day or in the near term before the day.
sen.cmt: saidよりassumedのほうが原文の意図に近いと思います。
sen.e: It is assumed that he died on this day or in the near term before the day.

sen.j: 慶雲元年（704年）7月22日に、功封40戸の4分の1が子の無位首名に伝えられた。
sen.e: In July 22, 704, a quarter of the 40 fuko was handed over to Mui no Obitona.
In August 30, 704, a quarter of the 40 fuko was handed over to his son Mui no Obitona.
In August 30, 704, a quarter of the 40 fuko was handed over to his son Mui no Obitona.

tit.e: Conjecture on the title of TAKATA no Niinomi, "Syuto in Mino Province"
tit.cmt: 下記内容から意訳しタイトルを変えて訳出しました
tit.e: Conjecture on the title of TAKATA no Niinomi, "Syuto in Mino Province"
Conjecture on the title of TAKATA no Niinomi, "Syuto in Mino Province"

sen.j: 『日本書紀』は壬申の乱で高田新家が鈴鹿郡で出迎えたことを記すが、その肩書きを記さない。
sen.e: Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan) described the reception of TAKATA no Niinomi in Suzuka County during Jinshin War, but his title was not written.
"Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) described the reception of TAKATA no Niinomi in Suzuka County during Jinshin War, but his title was not written.
"Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) described the reception of TAKATA no Niinomi in Suzuka County during Jinshin War, but his title was not written.

sen.j: 新家を美濃国主稲とするのは、『続日本紀』天平宝字7年（763年）11月28日条からの推測であふる。
sen.e: The idea that TAKATA no Niinomi is Syuto in Mino Province is a conjecture from the article of November 28, Tenpyo hoji 7 (763) of Shoku Nihongi (Chronicle of Japan Continued).
The idea that TAKATA no Niinomi was Syuto in Mino Province is a conjecture from the article of November 28, 763 (old lunar calendar) of "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued).
sen.cmt: 旧暦であることを付記しました。
sen.e: The idea that TAKATA no Niinomi was Syuto in Mino Province is a conjecture from the article of November 28, 763 (old lunar calendar) of "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued).

sen.j: そこには高田足人が罪により投獄され封戸を没収されたこととともに、「足人の祖父は美濃国の主稲で、壬申の兵乱に際して自分の馬で皇駕（天皇が乗る馬。天皇その人を間接的に指す）を美濃・尾張国に奉じた。天皇はこれを賞して封戸を与え子に伝えさせた」とある。
sen.e: According to the article, with the story that TAKATA no Tarito was jailed for a charge and his fuko were confiscated, it is said that Tarito's grandfather was Syuto in Mino Province and he devoted Koga (horse for the Emperor, the word can also imply the Emperor itself) by his own horse to Mino and Owari Province, then the Emperor praised his behavior, gave him fuko and let his children transfer them.
sen.cmt: 高田足人→定訳不明：TAKATA no Taritoとしました
sen.e: According to the article, with the story that TAKATA no Tarito was jailed for a charge and his fuko were confiscated, it is said that Tarito's grandfather was Syuto in Mino Province and he devoted Koga (horse for the Emperor, the word can also imply the Emperor itself) by his own horse to Mino and Owari Provinces, then the Emperor praised his behavior, gave him fuko and let him hand them down to his children.
sen.cmt: Mino and Owari Provincesと複数にしました。
sen.e: According to the article, with the story that TAKATA no Tarito was jailed for a charge and his fuko were confiscated, it is said that Tarito's grandfather was Syuto in Mino Province and he devoted Koga (horse for the Emperor, the word can also imply the Emperor itself) by his own horse to Mino and Owari Provinces, then the Emperor praised his behavior, gave him fuko and let him hand them down to his children.

sen.j: 祖父の名が記されないため確実ではないが、祖父は新家のことで、足人は首名の子ではないかと考えられている。
sen.e: Because the name of his grandfather was not written, it is not sure, but it is believed that the grandfather is TAKATA no Niinomi and TAKATA no Tarito is the child of Obitona.
Because the name of his grandfather was not written, it is not sure, but it is believed that the grandfather is TAKATA no Niinomi and TAKATA no Tarito is the child of Obitona.
Because the name of his grandfather was not written, it is not sure, but it is believed that the grandfather is TAKATA no Niinomi and TAKATA no Tarito is the child of Obitona.

sen.j: ここでいう美濃国主稲の性格については、大海人皇子の湯沐に関する官ではないかとされている。
sen.e: It is said that the character of Syuto in Mino Province as referred here is that of the post about Tomoku for Prince Oama.
sen.cmt: 湯沐→定訳不明：Tomokuとしました
sen.e: It is said that the character of Syuto in Mino Province as referred here is that of the post about Yunonagashi for Prince Oama.
sen.cmt: 前述の湯沐令の訳語からtomokuはyunonagashiに変更しました。
sen.e: It is said that the character of Syuto in Mino Province as referred here is that of the post about Yunonagashi for Prince Oama.
